location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.1854 of 1853, from Henry Edward Goldsmid, Secretary to the Government Bombay, to Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: Responding to Kemball's predecessor's last letter (f 311), Malet writes that, though it has long been forbidden by Government to exchange presents, he sees no objection of a gift to the value of 2000 rupees being made to the Imam of Muscat, before his departure for Zanzibar.
